Pearson Jeff M. Pearson has served the Satellite Beach Police Department since January of 1987, rising through the ranks to his current role as Police Chief. Chief Pearson oversees a department composed of 25 sworn officers and 10 support staff. He is responsible for all facets of department operations including the Patrol Division, Criminal Investigations Division, Records Division, Evidence Division, Administrative Support staff, department policy, budget, and volunteer programs. Chief Pearson began his career as a dispatch trainee and became a full-time dispatcher in March of 1987. In 1988, he enrolled in the Police Academy. He attended the Academy during the day and worked the Dispatch midnight shift until he graduated. In 1989, Chief Pearson realized his dream of becoming a law enforcement officer and was hired as a full-time Satellite Beach Police officer. He has held numerous positions during his career with the Satellite Beach Police Department including Field Training Officer, Detective, Corporal, Sergeant, Staff Sergeant, and Commander. In October of 2008, he was promoted to Deputy Chief, overseeing the Field Training Officer Program, Motorcycle Unit, Selective Traffic Enforcement Unit, DUI Enforcement, budget, Evidence, and Records. On August 1, 2011, after serving three years as the Deputy Chief, he was promoted to the Chief of Police. Originally from Rochester, New York, Chief Pearson moved to Brevard County in 1979. He attended Satellite High School and earned an Associate degree from Brevard Community College in 1990. In 2003, he graduated from The University of Central Florida with a Bachelor’s degree in Criminal Justice with a minor in Psychology. Chief Pearson furthered his education at Webster University, earning a Master’s degree in Public Administration in December of 2006. In recognition of his leadership and community service, Chief Pearson was honored as one of Lead Brevard’s “4 under 40” winners in 2007, highlighting his exceptional leadership qualities and extensive community involvement. He is an active member of the Brevard County Association of Chiefs of Police, the Florida Police Chiefs Association, the International Association of Chiefs of Police, and the FBI National Academy. He is an Executive Board Member of the Florida Police Chiefs Association and served as the 66th President of the Florida Police Chiefs Association in 2020. Florida Governor Rick DeSantis reappointed Chief Pearson to serve as a Commissioner on the Criminal Justice Standards and Training Commission, where he has served since 2016. Chief Jeff M. Pearson may be reached at (321) 773-4400 or by email at: [email protected] Deputy Chief Brad Hodge Deputy Chief Brad Hodge has served the Satellite Beach Police Department for over 35 years. He graduated from Satellite High School and furthered his education at the Santa Fe Institute of Public Safety in Gainesville, Florida, where he graduated top of his class and obtained his Law Enforcement certification. Deputy Chief Hodge pursued Public Administration at the University of Central Florida and is an esteemed graduate of the FBI National Academy’s 218th session. Throughout his prestigious career, he has garnered numerous accolades, including two-time Satellite Beach Officer of the Year, Brevard County Officer of the Year, and City of Satellite Beach Employee of the Year in both 2006 and 2013. In his current role as Support Services Deputy Chief, Deputy Chief Hodge oversees the following divisions: Criminal Investigations Evidence Communications School Resource Officer program Office of Professional Standards and Accreditation Internal Affairs Training Coordinator Emergency Response Team Commander Public Information Officer Deputy Chief Brad Hodge may be reached at (321) 773-4400  or by email at: [email protected] Lieutenant Ronnie Kinsey Lieutenant Ronnie Kinsey joined the Satellite Beach Police Department in 2020 upon relocating to Satellite Beach. Previously, he served nine years with the Clayton County Police Department near Atlanta, where he held roles in various specialized units including uniform patrol, Motor Vehicle Crash Investigations, Georgia’s H.E.A.T. Unit, and the Criminal Investigations Division. Lt. Kinsey also supervised the Uniform Patrol Division and led an Armed Robbery Suppression Unit. Lt. Kinsey holds two earned degrees: a Bachelor of Business Administration with a concentration in Marketing from Clayton State University in Morrow, GA, and a Master of Divinity with a concentration in Leadership from Liberty University in Lynchburg, VA. He is a 2024 graduate of the University of Louisville Southern Police Institute's 94th Command Officer's Development Course, a rigorous academic course that prepares the next generation of law enforcement leadership executives. He has accumulated nearly 2,000 hours of police training, including active certifications in Georgia and Florida, extensive expertise in DUI and impaired driving investigations, and specialized training in Internal Affairs, Advanced Criminal Procedures, and advanced supervision techniques. His primary area of specialization is traffic crash reconstruction. Currently, he heads the Traffic Homicide Investigations Unit at the Satellite Beach Police Department and leads the Beachside T.H.I. Taskforce, comprising Traffic Homicide Investigators from four agencies in Brevard County tasked with reconstructing fatal motor vehicle accidents. Beyond his professional pursuits, Lt. Kinsey treasures time spent with his wife and children. He is conversational in Spanish, enjoys traveling, hiking in the Rocky Mountains, and motorcycle riding. His favorite place to travel is the country of Uganda where he has been three times to do humanitarian work in the east African region. Lt. Ronnie Kinsey may be reached at (321) 773-4400 or by email at: [email protected] Lieutenant Anthony Holland Lieutenant Anthony Holland was born and raised in New Jersey, graduating from Mount Olive High School in 2003. His journey into public service began in 2006 when, at twenty years old, he enlisted in the United States Air Force. After completing basic training at Lackland Air Force Base in San Antonio, Texas, he served as a member of the USAF Security Forces Unit (Military Police). In 2010, Lieutenant Holland transferred to the USAF Reserves and relocated to Patrick Air Force Base, joining the 45th Security Forces Squadron. While Lieutenant Holland was stationed at Patrick Air Force Base, he was hired as a Corrections Deputy for the Brevard County Sheriff's Office. Lt. Holland worked for the Brevard County Sheriff's Office as a Corrections Deputy for three years. During this time, he enrolled in and attended the Corrections to Law Enforcement crossover academy at Eastern Florida State College, paving the way for his career as a Police Officer with the Satellite Beach Police Department. In 2013 Lieutenant Holland was hired by the Satellite Beach Police Department and served in the Uniformed Patrol Division before transferring to the Criminal Investigations Division as a detective in 2016. He was promoted to Corporal in 2017, Sergeant in 2019, and promoted to Lieutenant in 2022. Currently, he oversees the Criminal Investigations Division, School Resource Officer Unit, and the Communications Division. In 2021, Lieutenant Holland completed the Florida Leadership Academy (FLA Class #48), offered by the Florida Department of Law Enforcement, enhancing his leadership and professional skills. Lieutenant Holland has been recognized through many awards, including multiple Officer of the Quarter awards, the Hartmann/Flagg DUI Enforcement Officer of the Year award, and a Life Saving award in 2022. On his off days, Lieutenant Holland enjoys spending time with his wife, two sons and daughter. Lt. Anthony Holland may be reached at (321) 773-4400 ext. or by email at: [email protected] Back to the top Share this page Share this page × Copy and paste this code into your website. High concentrations of these bacteria may indicate the presence of microorganisms that could cause disease, infections, or rashes. Environmental Health is responsible for issuing health advisories or warnings when these conditions are confirmed. Sampling is conducted bi-weekly from the first week of March to the last week of September. To see the latest levels at Pelican Beach Park, click here . Read more about the program here . Contact info: 850-254-4240 EPA Beacon Program Public database of pollution occurrences for coastal recreation waters state and nationwide. The BEACON program provides a nationwide map that visitors can use and zoom into areas of concern to determine if there are any advisories or closures. Office Location: David R. Schechter Community Center 1089 South Patrick Drive Satellite Beach, FL 32937 Phone: (321) 773-6458 Fax: (321) 777-5207 Email : [email protected] Office Hours: Monday-Friday 8:30am-5pm Code of Conduct: Click here Payments Accepted: Cash, Check, Money Order, and Credit Cards (Visa/MasterCard/Discover/American Express). Please note that the credit card company (Forte) charges a minimum of $1.95 or 2.5% per transaction whichever is greater. Checks can only be accepted for facility rentals occurring more than thirty days out from time of payment. Refund Policy: Program refunds must be requested at least 5 business days prior to the start of the class, unless otherwise noted. If you notify the Recreation Department later than five full business days, but before the first day of class, you will receive a partial refund. No refunds will be issued the day of or after the class has begun. Please note: City Financial Policy is that checks must have 30 days to clear before a refund will be issued. Refunds back to a credit card are accomplished usually within 3 business days of the request.  Additional fees will be charged for checks returned NSF and participation can be suspended until fees are paid in full. For facility refunds, please refer to your facility contract for the reservation refund policy. (Please note the convenience fee for credit card use is non-refundable) NSF/Returned Check Policy: The following fees will be assessed on any NSF or Returned Check. No further registration or participation will be allowed until accounts/fees are paid in full. Upon notification of NSF or Returned Check, the City has given a grace period of 21 days before the full structure is invoked.  Until then citizens are asked to pay only $5 towards the cost of the dishonored check. Please call us for any questions or concerns. $25 fee for checks up to $50 $30 fee for checks from $50-$300 $40 or 5% fee (whichever is greater) for checks over $300 Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you prefer not to have your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, please call City Hall at 321-773-4407 or send request in writing to: City of Satellite Beach, 565 Cassia Boulevard, Satellite Beach, FL 32937. Lorraine Gott Dog Park Skate/BMX Park Playgrounds Sports Fields Samsons Island Rental Facilities DRS Community Center Pelican Beach Clubhouse Pelican Beach Park Civic Center Special Events Upcoming Events Calendar Volunteer Opportunities Community Involvement Recycling Opportunities Other Related Links Forms Open Gym Volunteer Opportunities BECOME A SATELLITE BEACH VOLUNTEER The City of Satellite Beach Recreation Department's Volunteer Involvement Program connects citizens to the city through community engagement. We coordinate efforts with local public and private schools, civic organizations, and the community to allow volunteer participation in a variety of city-sponsored events, camps, and programs. The City of Satellite Beach prides itself on our long history of citizen volunteers. Our founder, Percy Hedgecock, stated that “this community was built on the backs of citizen volunteers.” Satellite Beach students and adults are encouraged to invest time in their community. HOW DO I SIGN UP TO VOLUNTEER? Step 1 Submit your volunteer application by clicking the button below. If you have already completed an application, proceed to Step 2. Step 2 Click below to view and sign up for current, ongoing opportunities. (Must have completed the application in Step 1 to view opportunities.) If you do not remember your password, please DO NOT create a new account. Instead, click "reset password." Come join the fun and assist with our classes and community activities! Details can be found in your volunteer portal. If you have not yet registered to volunteer, please fill out an application above, then click on the "Join Us" button to register for any upcoming opportunities. If you have any questions, please contact the Satellite Beach Recreation Department: Ana Pazderak 321-773-6458 [email protected] WELCOME TO OUR VOLUNTEER COMMUNITY We are thrilled to offer a variety of ongoing volunteer opportunities throughout the city. Your time and effort can make a significant impact, and we can't wait to work with you! Seasonal Camps and Classes: Join us for our seasonal camps during Spring Break, Summer, and Winter Break. Volunteers are essential for set-up, tear-down, sign-in, cleanup, and assisting campers with activities and crafts. Some programs may also require prep work before the start of the program. Your help ensures a fun and smooth experience for all campers! Special Events: Be part of the excitement at our special events throughout the year! From Golf Cart Parades to Flashlight Easter Egg Hunts, Breakfast with the Bunny, Samsons Island Open House, Hook Kids on Fishing, Founder’s Day, Holiday Open House, and more, there's always something happening. Volunteers play a crucial role in making these events memorable. Beach & Community Cleanups: Join the Satellite Beach Sustainability and Beautification Boards in keeping our community beautiful. Opportunities include beach cleanups, Samsons Island workdays, community garden assistance, native plantings, and much more. Your efforts help preserve our natural spaces for everyone to enjoy. Special Projects: Do you have unique skills like photography, video, or crafts? We have special projects that could use your expertise. Reach out to us for more information and see how you can contribute your talents. Group and Corporate Opportunities: Looking for a team-building activity that gives back to the community? We offer special projects for groups on Samsons Island, in our Gopher Tortoise Conservation area, and across our parks and beaches. Contact our volunteer coordinator to find the perfect project for your team. Together, we can make a positive impact! To register for any of the above opportunities, please follow the steps above or contact the Recreation Department at 321-773-6458. We look forward to having you join our volunteer family! Looking for more volunteer opportunities in the City? Check out our Police Department's Community Volunteer Program which offers a variety of long-term volunteer opportunities such as Bike Patrol, Citizen Patrol, Stop By & Say Hi, Marine Patrol and more. Everyday from 10-5pm, May 24th-August 9th. Park hours are from 9:00am till dusk. Pelican Beach Park is our beachside park where many celebrated activities take place. It’s the perfect location for special events such as family gatherings, birthday parties, and company picnics.  Due to the popularity of the park, it is required that pavilions must be rented in order to utilize.  The volleyball courts are for use by pavilion renters with permits on the weekends. The amenities in the park include: Pavilions with Grills Volleyball Courts ADA Dun Crossover ADA Restrooms ADA Outdoor Showers ADA Parking Volleyball Courts The two volleyball sand courts can be used by the community without reservation during the week. However, on weekends the courts are reserved for use by renters of pavilions. Connecting Community Through Recreation, Wellness & Fun” We’re glad you’re here. Whether you're a resident or a visitor, we invite you to explore all that our department has to offer. From engaging programs and well-maintained facilities to exciting special events, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. Our dedicated team is honored to serve this vibrant community. We take pride in the trust you’ve placed in us and are committed to providing exceptional service, enriching experiences, and a welcoming environment for all. We hope you find our website helpful as you learn more about our offerings and stay connected with what’s happening in Satellite Beach. Warm regards, Cassie Warthen Recreation Director Our Mission To provide a variety of activities and services that promote health, fitness, relaxation, education, and enjoyment for our citizens and surrounding areas—while preserving the natural beauty of our beachside community. Contact Us 📍 Office Location: David R. Schechter Community Center 1089 South Patrick Drive Satellite Beach, FL 32937 📞 Phone: (321) 773-6458 📠 Fax: (321) 777-5207 📧 Email: [email protected] 🕒 Office Hours: Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM Code of Conduct: Click here Payments Accepted: The Satellite Beach Recreation Department offers several payment options including cash, personal checks, credit/debit cards, and money orders. Please note that when using a credit/debit card, a processing fee of 3.04% of the total cost will be added by the processing company. This fee is not retained by the City of Satellite Beach. Checks should be made payable to the City of Satellite Beach unless otherwise noted. Checks can only be accepted for facility rentals occurring more than thirty days out from time of payment. Refund Policy: Program refunds must be requested at least 5 business days prior to the start of the class, unless otherwise noted. If you notify the Recreation Department later than five full business days, but before the first day of class, you will receive a partial refund. No refunds will be issued the day of or after the class has begun. Please note: City Financial Policy is that checks must have 30 days to clear before a refund will be issued. Refunds back to a credit card are accomplished usually within 3 business days of the request.  Additional fees will be charged for checks returned NSF and participation can be suspended until fees are paid in full. For facility refunds, please refer to your facility contract for the reservation refund policy. (Please note the convenience fee for credit card use is non-refundable) NSF/Returned Check Policy: The following fees will be assessed on any NSF or Returned Check. No further registration or participation will be allowed until accounts/fees are paid in full. Upon notification of NSF or Returned Check, the City has given a grace period of 21 days before the full structure is invoked.  Until then citizens are asked to pay only $5 towards the cost of the dishonored check. Please call us for any questions or concerns. $25 fee for checks up to $50 $30 fee for checks from $50-$300 $40 or 5% fee (whichever is greater) for checks over $300 Under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you prefer not to have your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, please call City Hall at 321-773-4407 or send request in writing to: City of Satellite Beach, 565 Cassia Boulevard, Satellite Beach, FL 32937. The City of Satellite Beach offers a variety of rental facilities to help make your occasion memorable. From scenic picnic spots to versatile indoor spaces, we have options to suit gatherings of all sizes. DRS Community Center 🕒 Rental Hours: 8 AM – 1 AM 👥 Capacity: Varies by room Ideal for: Community functions, private parties 📍 Indoor space with flexible layout [Learn More →] Pelican Beach Clubhouse 🕒 Rental Hours: 8 AM – 1 AM 👥 Capacity: Up to 70 guests Oceanfront deck with stunning views Ideal for: Intimate celebrations, receptions [Learn More →] Pelican Beach Park 🕒 Rental Hours: 9 AM – Dusk 👥 Capacity: 12–70 guests (6 pavilions) Volleyball courts, playground, beach access Ideal for: Picnics, reunions, outdoor fun [Learn More →] Civic Center 🕒 Rental Hours: 8 AM – 1 AM 👥 Capacity: 50–150 guests Two rooms, kitchen, AV, WiFi, gazebo & pond view Ideal for: Weddings, meetings, community events [Learn More →] 📅 How to Reserve a Facility To book a space, contact the Recreation Department by phone or visit us in person. Once booked, you’ll have two weeks to complete your rental contract and submit payment. 💳 Payment Options We accept: Cash Checks (payable to City of Satellite Beach ) Credit Cards (3.04% processing fee added upon checkout) Note: If your event is within 30 days of booking, payment must be made by cash or credit card . Security Guidelines Some events may require a security guard, based on the Recreation Director’s discretion. If required, the renter is responsible for this cost. Plan Ahead Our facilities are popular and book quickly. We recommend reserving your preferred date and location well in advance . 🎥 Virtual Tour Take a virtual tour of our Civic Center: [ Coming Soon! → ] Share this page Share this page × Copy and paste this code into your website. While Public Works is mainly viewed as the maintenance vehicle for roads and grounds areas, there is a wide range of functions performed by the department that may go unseen by the public. As a beachside community, we have many areas where our residents and visitors can take advantage of the beautiful surroundings nature has provided. The frequent use of these facilities and the harsh salt environment requires that we continually maintain these areas to keep them safe and clean for all to use. Many of Satellite Beach’s residents and visitors enjoy walking or biking through the community. The City has many miles of sidewalk and bike paths, maintained by Public Works, which allow these activities to be done safely. Youth sports has always been a very important part of life in Satellite Beach. The City provides many athletic facilities for various sports. The Public Works Department works very hard to ensure that all of these facilities are well maintained for safe year round activity. To maintain the many components that make up the infrastructure of Satellite Beach, the Public Works Department is composed of five main divisions or teams. Administration: Administration is a key part of the Public Works mission. The Director and Assistant Director coordinate within the Department to respond to requests for services from Citizens and other Departments. They also interact with other entities, City, State or Federal, for problems in Satellite Beach that are out of our area of responsibility. For example, SR A1A is in Satellite Beach but is maintained by the Florida Department of Transportation, as is SR 513 (South Patrick Drive). If there is a problem on either of those roads, work must be coordinated through FDOT. Facilities Maintenance Team: Facilities maintains all City buildings, beach accesses/dune crossovers, and athletic field restroom/concession areas. They also maintain park facilities, such as Hightower Park and Pelican Beach Park; clubhouse, rental pavilions and restrooms. Roads and Drainage Team: Roads & Drainage maintain all City streets and sidewalks, with the exception of those along SR A1A and SR 513. Other responsibilities of this Team include: Street signs and stormwater system maintenance. Grounds Maintenance Team: The Grounds crew is responsible for the landscaping and maintenance of all City facilities, parks, and common areas. They are also responsible for public right-of-way areas such as DeSoto Parkway and Jamaica Boulevard. Maintaining the many athletic fields around the City is also a big part of the Grounds Team’s daily workload. Vehicle Maintenance: Our Chief Mechanic maintains all Police, Public Works, Fire, and Building and Zoning vehicles and equipment. Safe travels! Check-in – 4:00 PM Check-out – 11:00 AM Internet – Free WiFi is available in all areas of the hotel. Resort Fee – There is a service fee of $38.00 per night. Plus tax Parking – The parking fee is $42 per night before taxes. Unlimited in/out access Eligible Age to check-in – 21 years Pets are welcome! – We allow one dog 30lbs or under. There is a fee of $25 per night plus a onetime clean up fee of $150.00 *Pet reservations must be re approved by the hotel prior to arrival. Children – Children 12 sleeping in the same bed as parents stay free. Children Over 12 pay 3 rd occupancy rate plus extra bed rate. Extra Beds & Cribs – Rollaway beds in approved rooms subject to availability. $75 per day. Cribs are available, subject to availability and carry a rental fee of $75.00 per stay. Smoking – Our hotel is 100% non-smoking, sorry, no smoking is allowed. Guest Payment Options – We accept American Express, Visa, Euro/Mastercard, and Discover cards. Guest Information Required for Reservations and at Check-in: Guests will be required to provide a valid ID and at check-in.‍ All guests staying in the hotel must be registered with the front desk. Credit/Debit Card Pre-authorizations & Charges: Guest credit cards will be pre-authorized and charged for the first night room and tax prior to arrival. Credit/Debit Card Charges at Check-in: A $300 deposit will be held on the credit card provided at check in to cover incidental charges and damage upon check-in, and it will be released back to the same payment method at check out Cancellation policies: We offer free cancellations up to 72 hours prior to arrival, but early departures within this window are non-refundable. Please note that non-refundable rates are, as the name suggests, non-refundable. We’re excited to welcome you to the Pelican Hotel in the heart of Miami Beach! To ensure a smooth and enjoyable arrival experience, please take note of the following details: Address Information: Pelican Hotel 826 Ocean Drive Miami Beach, FL 33139 Tel: 305-673-3373 Check-In Time: Check-In Time: 4:00 PM EST. Please note that we cannot guarantee early check-in. To ensure access to guest rooms for guests traveling overnight, we recommend booking the night prior to facilitate early room availability. As a courtesy, the hotel will hold your bags on your day of arrival until your room is ready for check-in, allowing you time to explore the city. Check-Out Time: Check-Out Time: 11:00 AM EST. We regret that we cannot guarantee late check-out due to incoming guests. However, we would be pleased to hold your bags until you are ready to depart for the airport, port, or next destination. Please note that we do not hold bags once you have checked out of the hotel. Parking: For guests arriving by car, we offer valet parking at the Pelican Hotel for $42.00 per day with in/out services. Please approach the hotel entrance upon arrival, and our valet attendants will assist you with parking arrangements. Airport Transportation: For guests arriving at Miami International Airport (MIA) or Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport (FLL), or Ports, we recommend transportation options such as taxis, ride-sharing services, and rental cars. Please contact our concierge team for assistance and pricing with arranging private limo airport transportation in advance. Special Requests: We strive to accommodate our guests needs and preferences to ensure a memorable stay. If you have any special requests or require additional assistance during your arrival, please inform us in advance, and we’ll do our best to accommodate you. We look forward to welcoming you and making your stay with us unforgettable! Welcome to the Pelican Hotel Miami Beach! To make your stay even more enjoyable, here are some convenient transportation options for exploring the vibrant city of Miami Beach. Public Transportation Miami-Dade Transit (MDT): The Miami-Dade Transit system offers extensive bus routes and Metrorail services throughout the city. Bus stops are conveniently run along Collins Avenue and Washington Avenue, providing easy access to the Government Center Metrorail station in downtown Miami. Metrorail: Metrorail is a rapid transit system serving Miami-Dade County with convenient connections to downtown Miami and other major destinations (like the speed train to Orlando) From Government Center Metrorail Station, you can also take the Metrorail Orange line towards Miami International Airport (MIA) Disembark at the next stop, Miami Central Station Take the Brightline train to Orlando Additionally, keep in mind that transportation options and schedules may change, so it’s best to verify the current information closer to your travel date. Hop-on-Hop-off: The Red Bus is a popular hop-on hop-off tour service that allows visitors to discover Miami Beach, Little Havana, Wynwood, Coconut Grove and other top attractions. The buses are double-decker, providing great views of the city as you travel. Passengers can hop on and off at any designated stops along the route, making it easy to explore different areas of Miami Beach. See the concierge for pricing. Free Rides and Shuttle Services Freebee: Freebee offers on-demand, eco-friendly transportation within specific areas of Miami Beach. Download the Freebee app to request a ride and enjoy complimentary transportation to nearby attractions, restaurants, and shops. Miami Beach Trolley: The Miami Beach Trolley is a free transportation option that connects popular destinations within Miami Beach, including South Beach, North Beach, and Mid-Beach. Look for the nearest trolley stop close to the Pelican Hotel to hop on board and explore the area hassle-free. Additional Transportation Options Ride-Sharing Apps: Utilize popular ride-sharing apps like Uber and Lyft for convenient door-to-door transportation around Miami Beach. Simply request a ride through the app, and a driver will pick you up at the Pelican Hotel and take you to your desired destination. Bicycle Rentals: CitiBikes Conveniently located across the street with numerous dock stations around Miami Beach.  The solar-powered bike sharing system consists of a fleet of specially designed, sturdy, very durable bikes that are locked into a network of docking stations sited at regular intervals around a city. With 160+ station locations and more on the way, bikes are available to use 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. There are two distinct ways to utilize the Citi Bike program, Hourly Rental. Explore Miami Beach at your own pace. Accessibility Commitment at Pelican Hotel At Pelican Hotel, we are dedicated to ensuring that our website is accessible to all individuals, regardless of their circumstances and abilities. Our commitment extends to conforming with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0, Level AA) set forth by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Guiding Principles The WCAG guidelines provide a comprehensive framework for enhancing web content accessibility, specifically designed to accommodate users with disabilities. We strive to align our website closely with these principles to create an inclusive and user-friendly online environment. Ongoing Efforts While we work diligently to uphold accessibility standards throughout www.pelicanhotel.com, we acknowledge that achieving perfection in every aspect can be challenging. Our team is actively engaged in an ongoing effort to address any areas where compliance may be currently lacking. Dynamic Nature of the Website Please be aware that our website is dynamic and regularly updated to provide fresh and relevant content. Due to this dynamic nature, minor accessibility issues may occasionally arise. Rest assured, we are committed to promptly identifying and rectifying any such issues as they occur. Continuous Improvement Pelican Hotel is dedicated to ensuring that every section of our website attains the highest level of web accessibility. We are continually exploring and implementing solutions to elevate the overall accessibility of our site, fostering an inclusive online experience for all users. Your Feedback Matters Your input is invaluable to us. If you have any comments or suggestions regarding the accessibility of our site, please do not hesitate to contact our accessibility coordinator. You can reach us via email at reservation@pelicanhotel.com or by phone at 305-673-3373. Your feedback plays a crucial role in our ongoing efforts to enhance accessibility, and we appreciate your assistance in making our website more accessible for everyone. Thank you for choosing Pelican Hotel. The City of Satellite Beach offers a variety of Special Events throughout the year through our Recreation Department as well as through our strong community partnerships. Click the link below to view our events calendar or follow us on Facebook: EVENTS CALENDAR #PLAYSATELLITEBEACH PLANNING AN EVENT IN SATELLITE BEACH? The Recreation Department exists to serve the community and to guide event planners through the special event permitting procedure. Any  special events, such as surf/skate contests, runs/walks, parades, block parties and citywide holiday celebrations that take place on both City Owned Property or Non-City Owned Property are initiated with our office. For the safety and well-being of participants and the public, the City of Satellite Beach requires submission of a Special Event Application along with a to-scale Site Plan for both City Owned Property events and Non-City Owned Property events. Click the link to the below for pdf Special Events Application. If you have any questions contact us at 321-773-6458 to schedule a pre-application review meeting. PLANNING A BEACH CEREMONY? Event is generating income from attendees Over 25 attendees Commercial support provided. Equipment, tents, arch, chairs, generators etc. (These are not provided by the city, but are allowed.) Hartmann~Flagg Memorial Page Volunteers FAQs & Links City of Satellite Beach Contact Information Contact Us SATELLITE BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT Welcome Letter from the Chief Welcome to the Satellite Beach Police Department’s website.  On behalf of the proud members of our department, we are pleased to present the accomplishments of our safe and beautiful City. The Satellite Beach Police Department is committed to serving our community.  We value going above and beyond the call of duty and doing more than others expect.  Through careful employee selection and continuous training, the Satellite Beach Police Department delivers professional, ethical, and compassionate public safety services to our residents, businesses, and visitors. Dedicated police officers, civilian staff, crossing guards, and volunteers pledge to protect, serve, and improve the quality of life throughout our community.  The community benefits from the law enforcement services provided through the following divisions: Patrol, K-9, Emergency Response Team, School Resource Officers, Criminal Investigations, Professional Standards, Traffic Homicide Investigations Unit, Victim Advocate, Communications, Records, and Property & Evidence. The Satellite Beach Police Department Volunteer Program is designed to enhance our delivery of public safety services by providing people a way to share their time and talents with our community.   Volunteers perform meaningful roles which directly impact the quality of life in our community by serving in various volunteer programs like C.O.P. (Citizens on Patrol), Marine Patrol, ATV Beach Patrol, Bike Patrol, Fingerprinting, House Checks, Administration, and Stop By & Say Hi. Our motto “Serving Our Community” is not just a slogan – it is our daily mission. The men and women of the Satellite Beach Police Department take pride in our service to the community and remain committed to earning the trust and confidence of the community we serve every day. Chief Jeff M. Pearson The Satellite Beach Department is firmly committed to equal employment opportunity and provides for equal opportunity before and during employment with the Department for all applicants and employees regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, political affiliation, disability, marital status, or other similar factors not job related. Lorraine Gott Dog Park Skate/BMX Park Playgrounds Sports Fields Samsons Island Rental Facilities DRS Community Center Pelican Beach Clubhouse Pelican Beach Park Civic Center Special Events Upcoming Events Calendar Volunteer Opportunities Community Involvement Recycling Opportunities Other Related Links Forms Open Gym Beach Bonfires BONFIRE SEASON RUNS NOVEMBER THRU THE END OF FEBRUARY BONFIRE SEASON IS CLOSED Recreational beach bonfires have long been part of the culture of Satellite Beach for decades. Per City Ordinance 26-31: outdoor burning shall only be allowed with a permit, that includes ceremonial fires, recreational fires, bonfires and campfires. Bonfire season runs November 1 ST through February 28 TH . No permits will be issued from March 1 ST through October 31 ST due to sea turtle nesting season. Several changes have been made to the permitting process for individuals interested in obtaining a bonfire permit. All permits will be issued by the Recreation Department (Located at 1089 S. Patrick Drive, Satellite Beach, FL 32937) on a first come, first serve basis. Permit fees are $50 each, plus a fully refundable security/damage deposit in the amount of $100 per bonfire site, and a signed and notarized hold harmless agreement. PLEASE NOTE: Last minute bonfire permits issued for the upcoming weekend must have the notarized paperwork completed and be paid for in full no later than 12pm on Friday (or by 12pm Wednesday for weekend of Thanksgiving/Christmas). Click arrow (-->) on top left corner of the map for complete list of bonfire sites Refund Policy: Refunds are available if requested at least 3 full business days prior to the permit date. A full refund of the permit fee and deposit will be mailed approximately 3 weeks following the notice of cancellation. Refunds requested less than 3 full business days, but still prior to reservation date will result in forfeiture of the permit fee, however, the security/damage deposit will be returned following the notice of cancellation, approximately 3 weeks (if paid by credit card, it will be processed back to the card immediately). Security/Damage Deposit Refund: A full refund of your security/damage deposit will be returned to you after your event providing you abided by the bonfire rules and regulations. The security/damage deposit refund will be processed and mailed to you approximately 3 weeks following permitted date or applied directly back to the credit card used to make payment. If your deposit is withheld, you will be notified by the city within 2-3 business days. Office Location: David R. Schechter Community Center 1089 South Patrick Drive, Suite 105 Satellite Beach, FL 32937 Phone: (321) 773-6458 Fax: (321) 777-5207 Email : [email protected] Office Hours: Monday-Friday 8:30am-5pm Payments Accepted: Cash, Check, Money Order, and Credit Cards (Visa/MasterCard/Discover/American Express). Please note that the credit card company (Forte) charges a minimum of $2.00 or 2.55% per transaction whichever is greater. Checks can only be accepted for bonfires occuring more than thirty days out from time of payment. Share this page Share this page × Copy and paste this code into your website. Satellite Beach Recreation Department Volunteer Involvement Program (VIP): Become a Satellite Beach VIP! Satellite Beach Recreation Department offers our Volunteer Involvement Program to connect citizens to the City through community engagement.  The Volunteer Involvement Program coordinates efforts with local schools, community groups and the public to allow volunteer participation in many City sponsored events, camps, and programs. Satellite Beach students and adults are encouraged to invest time in their community. If you are interested, submit a completed volunteer application and contact Ana Pazderak at (321) 773-6458 or [email protected] for more information. Satellite Beach Community Paramedic Program: Satellite Beach Fire Department offers in-home health evaluations for older citizens who have chronic health conditions. Community Health Paramedics will schedule appointments to visit citizens in their homes as needed to conduct physical exams and check ups. Services provided include: In-Home Paramedic exam on a weekly visit, 12 Lead EGG, Vitals including weight, Blood Glucose, Oxygen Saturation, Medication review and compliance, Nutrition review and compliance, Link with Primary Care Provider(s) to provide first hand observations about your health status and potential needs, as well as Link to Community Services to enhance your quality of life. To request additional  information, contact the Satellite Beach Fire Department, Monday-Friday 9am-4pm by calling (321) 773-4405 Ext. 4, or visit the Community Paramedic Program page . Satellite Beach Police Department Volunteer Program: Satellite Beach is known for their volunteers who want to make a difference and give back to the community.  Our existing police volunteer presence and support have provided a solid contribution to our quality of life. Because of our volunteers, we are able to provide a wider range of services to our residents and extend Police visibility as the volunteers patrol the neighborhoods. COPS also assist with city special events. In order to be a volunteer you must successfully pass a background check and be able to donate 2 hours a week. If you are interested, please visit the SBPD Volunteer Page at https://satellitebeach.gov/departments/police_department/volunteers.php . Stop By & Say Hi Program: The Satellite Beach Police Department Volunteer Program provides a beneficial program titled “Stop By & Say Hi” where our volunteers literally do just that with our City residents. We provide companionship and become a friend who is close by. Our compassionate volunteers provide laughter, brighten a day, and let our residents know they are not forgotten and that we care in Satellite Beach. We also offer basic resources and support. The program is free of charge and confidential. There are no requirements except that they must live in the City limits of Satellite Beach. The resident can be of any age or background and can be someone who would enjoy having someone to talk to while they reminisce about the good old days. We encourage you to recommend someone you know to [email protected] or call the Satellite Beach Police Department: (321) 773-4400 ext 412. A referral form is located at City Hall or the SB Police Station. It is also available on the Stop By and Say Hi page . Volunteers in Motion: The Volunteers in Motion Program began in 1996 and helps seniors live independently by offering life sustaining  transportation to medical appointments, pharmacies and to the grocery store. This service is coordinated by Space Coast Area Transit. Volunteers in Motion will provide specialized vans which will accommodate mobility devices in support of our Satellite Beach’s Community Paramedic, Stop By & Say Hi Program and Neighbor Helping Neighbor residents. This is an exciting new opportunity for the City of Satellite Beach residents who participate in one of these programs so that transportation will be available. Samsons Island Adopt-A-Park Program: Samsons Island Nature Park is a 52-acre island owned by the City of Satellite Beach located in the Indian River Lagoon.  Since 1991, City volunteers and staff have worked diligently to re-vegetate local flora and fauna on this spoil island so the community can enjoy a small piece of open land. The City’s Adopt-A-Park program recruits individuals, families and local organizations to lend a hand with park duties that fit their ability level. Individuals and families can volunteer on the island on a schedule convenient to them, while organizations are asked to commit to work parties at least twice a year. Those interested in volunteering on Samsons Island can contact Cassie Warthen, Satellite Beach Recreation Director, via email at [email protected] or call by phone at 773-6458. Sport Organizations: Youth sport organizations in Satellite Beach are always looking for good volunteers. Duties can range from board positions to concession stand workers, coaches, managers, or team parents. Most sport league websites list their volunteer opportunities. The sport league websites are listed in our current activity brochure. Community Board/Committees: There are many citizen boards that advise City Council on important issues concerning community growth and policy management. One such board is coordinated through the Recreation Department:  The Recreation Board members recommend future facilities and recreation related policies to the City Council.  If you are interested in participating in a City board, visit the City Boards page to view current vacancies and download an application or contact the City Clerk's Office at 773-4407. Satellite Beach Library: Please call 779-4004 to find out how to become involved with the Library. Share this page Share this page × Copy and paste this code into your website. Kids of all ages are invited to explore fire trucks, dump trucks, construction vehicles, and more at this hands-on event. Climb aboard, sit in the driver’s seat, and experience the excitement of these mighty machines up close! Location: DeLaura Middle School Parking Lot Time: 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM 🔇 Horn-Free Hour: 10:00 – 11:00 AM (ideal for children with sensitive ears) Admission: FREE – Adult supervision required Have a Big Rig You Want to Show Off at Big Truck Day? Do you have a truck, vehicle, or piece of heavy equipment that kids (and grown-ups!) would love to see up close? We’re looking for awesome participants to display their vehicles at Big Truck Day on September 27th in Satellite Beach! Whether it’s a fire truck, tow truck, construction vehicle, or something totally unique — we’d love to have you join the fun! 👉 Interested in bringing a big truck? Fill out our quick form or contact us at 321-773-6458 or [email protected] to reserve a space. (Guest attendance registration not required). This event is proudly presented in partnership with Beachside Smiles Pediatric Dentistry and Space Coast Urgent Care . Halloween Golf Cart Parade - Friday, October 24th Presented by the Satellite Beach Golf Cart Club & the City of Satellite Beach Sponsored by Realty World Curri Properties Get ready for a spooky night of fun at our annual Halloween Golf Cart Parade ! Watch as creatively decorated golf carts roll through town in costume, bringing Halloween spirit to life. The event features a parade , costume and cart decoration contests , food trucks , music , prizes , and more! Parade Details: Check-In Begins: 5:00 PM All Participants Must Be Signed In By: 5:45 PM Parade Step-Off: 6:00 PM Start Location: DeLaura Middle School End Location: Satellite Beach Sports Park (750 Jamaica Blvd) Parade Route: Will be posted on Facebook closer to the event date Registration Fees: Early Bird: $10 per cart (Aug 4 – Sept 12) Regular: $15 per cart (Sept 13 – Oct 23) Day-of Registration: $20 per cart 👉 Click here to register your cart! 👻 Not registering a cart? Spectators are welcome! Join us along the parade route or at the finish line for a free family festival with food, music, and Halloween fun for all ages. Founders Day Celebration – Saturday, November 1st Join us for one of Satellite Beach’s most beloved traditions— Founders Day ! From 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM at the DRS Community Center , enjoy a full day of fun featuring the Satellite Beach Woman’s Club Marketplace with over 200 craft and specialty vendors , live music, food, and family-friendly activities. The Founders Day Parade kicks off at 11:00 AM from DeLaura Middle School and ends at the DRS Community Center. This year’s theme, “Join Our Flock,” is inspired by vibrant flamingo artwork created by DeLaura Middle School students and celebrates the power of community, teamwork, and connection. 📣 Vendor applications are open through September 15 . To apply, call the Recreation Department at 321-773-6458 . 👉 Want to be in the parade? Click here to register your group or float! Holiday Golf Cart Parade - Friday, December 19th Presented by the Satellite Beach Golf Cart Club & the City of Satellite Beach Get ready to deck the carts and light up the night ! 🌟 Join us for the most magical event of the season — the Annual Holiday Golf Cart Parade in Satellite Beach! Whether you're cruising in a cart or cheering from the sidelines, this festive celebration is packed with holiday cheer, twinkling lights, and community spirit. Event Highlights: Holiday-themed golf cart parade Decoration contest with prizes Food trucks & live music Family festival at the finish line Parade Details: Check-In Begins: 4:30 PM All Participants Must Be Signed In By: 5:15 PM Parade Step-Off: 5:30 PM Start Location: DeLaura Middle School End Location: Satellite Beach Sports Park (750 Jamaica Blvd) Parade Route: Will be posted on Facebook closer to the event date Registration Fees: Registration Opens Oct 25th Early Bird: $10 per cart (Oct 25 – Nov 22)) Regular: $15 per cart (Nov 23 - Dec18) Day-of Registration: $20 per cart 🎅 Not registering a cart? No problem! Spectators are welcome to line the parade route and join us at the finish line for a free family festival filled with music, food, and holiday magic. International Coastal Cleanup - Saturday, September 20th Be part of a global movement to protect our oceans and waterways! The City of Satellite Beach is proud to participate in the 40th Annual International Coastal Cleanup , founded by Ocean Conservancy and locally sponsored by Keep Brevard Beautiful (KBB) . Saturday, September 20th | 8:00 AM – 12:00 PM City staff will be stationed at Pelican Beach Park , while our amazing partners, SWAT (Students Working Against Tobacco) , will lead efforts at Hightower Beach . Volunteers of all ages are invited to help remove litter from our beautiful coastline and contribute to the world’s largest database on marine debris using Ocean Conservancy’s Clean Swell® app . Since its inception, the International Coastal Cleanup has mobilized over 18 million volunteers to remove more than 380 million pounds of trash from beaches and waterways worldwide. Every piece of litter collected helps protect marine life and keeps our local environment clean and safe. What to Bring: Closed-toe shoes Reusable water bottle Sunscreen & hat Enthusiasm to make a difference! Student service hours available! No registration required—just show up ready to help. Supplies will be provided. Let’s work together to #SeaTheChange and keep Satellite Beach beautiful! Share this page Share this page × Copy and paste this code into your website.
